page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Institute from which the following is extracted..(copy held in Somerset Local History Library in Taunton). "..The name Trull is derived from the Old English{TRENDEL},meaning a ring or circle...The roughly circular shape of the churchyard of All Saints Trull may be significant...The present parish formed part of the huge estate given by Aethelwulf,King of the West Saxons to Ealhstan,Bishop of Winchester.The {Saxon charter}(A.D.854?)gives the boundaries of this estate...Trull church was probably originally built to serve a different parish to the modern area;and in fact the Trindle of the year 1207-1208 undoubtably included the mill as well as the areas known as the tithings of North Trendle and Dipford..Trull is first mentioned as a{parish}in 1534-5.."The 'Story of Trull'has many excellent details.
